boat.full_description:
Designed as 26 foot Gaff Sloop by “Uncle Rous“ vice-Commodore of the Hong Kong Yacht Club and a yacht designer . Around six of his yachts are thought to have survived into the second Millennium . Mairi Bhan was initially built as Typhoon in around 1930. We think she was brought to britain between the wars and renamed Mairi. She is in the Loyde's register for 1962 as Mairi Bhan (previously Mairi) Based in Poole.

We rescued her from being scrapped about eight years ago and since then have worked to bring her back to life.  We have sailed her for a full season prior to being brought out for winter berthing on the dry. She is a dream to sail.  She has now been fully restored with all the hull and decking re calked. Compleatly rewired and a new reconditioned engine fitted.
boat.name: Mairi Bhan
boat.short_description: Designed as 26 foot Gaff Sloop and converted to Bermudan rig in the 60's
